items.description: Data ID.
items.title: id

items.description: Score for the data. Negative (normal) data are scored around 1.0. Higher score means higher abnormality.
items.title: score

___calc_score.description: Calculates an anomaly measure value for the point data row without adding a point. At this time, extremely large numbers can be returned. For the detail, please refer to FAQs:anomaly detection.
___calc_score.title: calc_score

___return.description: Anomaly measure value for given row

$eref.description: Represents a set of data used for machine learning in Jubatus.
$eref.title: datum

items.description: Input data represented in string. It is represented as key-value pairs of data. Name of keys cannot contain “$” sign.
items.title: string_values

items.description: Input data represented in numeric value. It is represented as key-value pairs of data.
items.title: num_values

items.description: Input data represented in binary value. It is represented as key-value pairs of data.
items.title: binary_values

items.description: datum

___add_bulk.description: Adds a bulk of points. In contrast to add, this API doesn’t return anomaly measure values.

___return.description: The list of successfully added IDs.
